definition:
to continue in time                                      
             
             The movie lasted about two hours.

to remain fresh or unimpaired : endure                                      
             
             That paint job should last a long time.

to manage to continue (as in a course of action)                                      
             
             She won't last; she'll quit before the week's out.

to continue to live                                      
             
             he will not last very much longer

to be enough for the needs of                                      
             
             The supplies will last them a week.

to continue in existence or action as long as or longer than                                      
                
                  —often used with out          couldn't last out the training program

following all the rest                                      
             
             He was the last one out.

being the only remaining                                      
             
             our last dollar

belonging to the final stage (as of life)                                      
             
             her last hours on earth

next before the present : most recent                                      
             
             last week

most up-to-date : latest                                      
             
             It's the last thing in fashion.

farthest from a specified quality, attitude, or likelihood                                      
             
             would be the last person to fall for flattery
lowest in rank or standing

distinct, separate                                      
                
                  —used as an intensive          ate every last piece of food

conclusive                                      
             
             There is no last answer to the problem.
highest in degree : supreme, ultimate

after all others : at the end                                      
             
             came last and left first

most lately                                      
             
             saw her last in Rome

in conclusion                                      
             
             Last, let's consider the social aspect.
something that is last

at the end of a period of time : finally                                      
             
             At last you've come home.
a form (as of metal or plastic) which is shaped like the human foot and over which a shoe is shaped or repaired
to shape with a last
coming after all others in time, order, or importance
remaining after the rest are gone
belonging to the final part of something
after any others in time, order, or importance : at the end
most recently : on the most recent occasion
—used to introduce a final statement or subject

to go on                                      
             
             The game lasted two hours.

to stay in good condition                                      
             
             These sneakers won't last.

to be enough for the needs of                                      
             
             We have food to last the week.

to be able to continue in a particular condition                                      
             
             Are you too hungry to last till lunch?

after any others in time or order                                      
             
             She spoke last.

most recently                                      
             
             They were last seen here.

following all the rest : final                                      
             
             I was the last one out.

most recent                                      
             
             last week

lowest in rank or position                                      
             
             Our team was last in the league.

most unlikely                                      
             
             You're the last person I thought I'd see.

a person or thing that is last                                      
             
             That order was my last.

after a long period of time : finally                                      
             
             We're finished at last!
in: The movie lasted about two hours.
That paint job should last a long time.
She won't last; she'll quit before the week's out.
he will not last very much longer
The supplies will last them a week.
couldn't last out the training program
He was the last one out.
our last dollar
her last hours on earth
last week
His last book was a failure.
It's the last thing in fashion.
would be the last person to fall for flattery
ate every last piece of food
There is no last answer to the problem.
came last and left first
saw her last in Rome
Last, let's consider the social aspect.
At last you've come home.
the search for peace will continue
buy shoes that will last
in spite of everything, her faith endured
a love that abides through 40 years of marriage
the sense of guilt persisted
last page of a book
last news we had of him
final day of school
terminal phase of a disease
the ultimate collapse of the system
He was the last one out of the building.
She succeeded on her last attempt.
These are the last two books in the series.
We are going to the beach for the last week of the summer.
the last cookie in the jar
She said she wouldn't marry him if he was the last man on earth.
He was tragically killed during the last days of the war.
I haven't seen her recently. The last time we met was at a party.
He spoke last at the meeting.
My horse was last in the race.
She was first to arrive at the party and last to leave.
I last saw him in the supermarket.
They last went to the beach in June.
This word was last used in the 17th century.
The game lasted two hours.
These sneakers won't last.
We have food to last the week.
Are you too hungry to last till lunch?
She spoke last.
They were last seen here.
I was the last one out.
Our team was last in the league.
You're the last person I thought I'd see.
That order was my last.
We're finished at last!
I spent my last dollar on a ticket.
This is the final game of the championship.

definition: used for referring to the week, month, year etc that ended most recently
used for referring to a period of time that has continued up to the present
used for referring to a particular event, occasion, person, or thing that is the most recent one of its kind
happening or coming at the end after all the others
used for referring to someone or something that remains after all the rest have gone, or to part of an amount that remains after the rest has been used
used for emphasizing that someone or something is not at all likely, suitable, or wanted in a particular situation
in: last week/year/Saturday etc: How did you boys sleep last night?
Last year the company made a profit of £350 million.
the last week/month/year etc: Over the last 15 years there has been a 50% increase in the traffic on our roads.
During the last hour we have been receiving reports of an explosion in the city centre.
The last time we met both of us had just started new jobs.
They’ve had only one win from their last eight matches.
I’m afraid I don’t agree with that last comment.
I had my last child at home.
His next book will be even better than his last.
I last saw her three years ago.
I swear this is the last cigarette I will ever smoke.
Fry the onions until crisp, and add them last.
Tonight’s performance is the last in a series.
the last of: When the last of the lorries had gone by, the street was reopened.
the last to do something: Janice was the last to leave.
Why am I always the last to find out about these parties?
the last someone sees/hears of: His plane disappeared into the clouds, and that was the last we ever saw of him.
I wouldn’t marry him if he was the last man on earth.
the last surviving copy of the manuscript
I hope to be among the last four in the tournament.
the last of: He is the last of his generation.
Who wants the last of the ice cream?
The last thing we need is a tax rise.
Hurting you is the last thing I’d want to do.
I’m the last person you should be asking for advice.
at the last moment/minute
at (long) last
if it’s the last thing I do
last but not least
the last I heard
last in, first out
last (of all)
last thing (at night)
leave/save/keep something until last
next/second to last
the night/week/year etc before last
on its last legs
on your last legs
to the last

definition: (the person or thing) after everyone or everything else:
finally:
the least expected or wanted person or thing:
at the latest time in the day:
If you say that it is the last time you will do something, you mean that you will never do it again:
(being) the only one or part that is left:
(being) the most recent or the one before the present one:
to continue to exist:
to continue being good or suitable:
the person or thing after everyone or everything else:
the only one or part that is left:
the most recent, or the one before the present one:
being the least desirable or least likely:
to continue for a period of time, or to continue to exist:
To last is also to continue in a situation although it is difficult:
To last is also to continue to work well or stay in good condition:
(coming) after everyone or everything else:
most recent, or most recently:
(in ending a set of items or a series of thoughts) finally:
in: I hate being the last one to arrive at a meeting.
Our house is the last one on the left before the traffic lights.
The Mets will surely finish the season in last place (= at the lowest rank of their division).
I know Johnson finished last in the race, but who was second to last (= the one before the one at the end)?
I don't know why he bothers to bet - his horses always come in last.
At the last moment (= as late as possible) he changed his mind.
He always leaves important decisions to the last (possible) moment (= as late as possible).
I've finished my essay at last!
At long last the government is starting to listen to our problems.
Three extra people to feed - that's the last thing I need!
The last thing I wanted was to make you unhappy.
Matthew is the last person I'd expect to be interested in dance.
He's the last person I'd trust with my keys.
I'll switch on the washing machine last thing so it'll be finished when I get up in the morning.
He never even thanked me, so that's the last time I do him a favour.
Do you mind if I have the last chocolate?
I'm down to my last dollar - could I borrow some money for lunch?
I'm afraid Martha's eaten the last of the ice cream.
She was the last of the great educational reformers.
Did you hear the storm last night (= during the previous night)?
Did you see the news on TV last night (= yesterday evening)?
They got married last November.
When was the last time you had a cigarette?
When did you last have a cigarette?
She's been working there for the last month (= for the four weeks until now).
Could you account for your whereabouts on Sunday last?
The/These last five years have been very difficult for him.
The last we heard of her, she was working as an English teacher in France.
Each of her paintings has been better than the last.
The meeting lasted two hours.
The drought lasted for several months.
They say the snow will last until the end of next week.
I can't see the ceasefire lasting.
They haven't had an argument for two weeks, but it's too good to last (= they'll have an argument soon).
I doubt their enthusiasm will last.
He's working very efficiently at the moment, but it won't last.
There's no point buying something that isn't going to last.
The cheaper washing machines should last about five years.
This pen should last (you) a lifetime if you take care of it.
Her previous secretary only lasted a month (= left after this period).
Heather was the last to go to bed and the first to get up.
Mark ate the last of the ice cream.
We had lunch together the week/month before last (= two weeks/months ago).
The last we heard, she was teaching English overseas.
Each of her novels seems better than the last.
Traveling across the country with two small children is the last thing I want to do.
The tour lasts about an hour.
She’s into soccer at the moment, but it won’t last.
Her previous secretary only lasted a month.
I’d rather pay a little more and buy clothing that’s going to last.
In math tests, American students came in last (= ranked the lowest).
He was last in line for tickets.
Our house is the last one on the left.
Despite recent wins, the team is still in last place (= lowest in rank among it competitors).
last night/week/month/year
last spring/summer/fall/winter
These last five years have been very difficult for him.
Kristal said in her last letter that she might come to visit.
When was the last time you went to the movies?
We last saw Grandma in 1994.
The men begin the dance, then the women enter, and last, the children join in.

translated_as@ru: самый неподходящий или неожиданный человек/предмет и т. д.

translated_as@fr: dernier/-ière
le dernier livre de la collection
C’est la dernière maison là-bas à droite.
Il est arrivé dernier de la compétition.
Nous n’étions que des enfants la dernière fois que nous nous sommes rencontrés.
Quel est le dernier film que tu aies vu ?
Où êtes-vous allés en vacances l’année dernière ?
le dernier sandwich sur l’assiette
les quelques derniers vétérants survivants de la première guerre mondiale
la dernière minute/seconde
Pourquoi as-tu attendu la dernière minute pour appeler ?
la dernière personne/chose
La dernière chose dont j’ai besoin maintenant
c’ est d’un visiteur surprise.
en dernier
Nous avons déposé Lola en dernier.
la dernière fois
Quand avez-vous vu un docteur pour la dernière fois ?
enfin et surtout
Et enfin mais surtout
je voudrais remercier ma mère.
le/la dernier/-ière
N’utilise pas le restant de lait.
Dan était le dernier dans la file.
enfin
Enfin
les voilà !
durer
Mon mal de tête n’a pas duré très longtemps.
La réunion du personnel a duré des heures.
Il fait du soleil maintenant mais je doute que ça dure.
Ces piles ne durent pas longtemps.
La nourriture que nous avons devrait nous faire toute la semaine.
dernier

definition: anything behind first place.

Marginalized Orientations, Gender identities, And Intersex. it’s meant to be an all inclusive umbrella term for asexuals, homosexuals, multisexuals, trans people, and intersex people. Alternative to LGBTQIAP+
Alternative to MOGII, easier to pronounce.

LAST is an acronym for Latino American Standard Time. There are essentially three guiding principles behind LAST.1.) To be “on time” means one can show up at any point up to 1 hour after the agreed upon time.
2.) If one arrives between 1 hour up to 2 hours after, it’s “cutting it close”.3.) Lastly, if one arrives anytime after 2 hours they are officially “late”, and any time before the agreed upon time qualifies them as a “lunatic” (or any other variant of this word).e.g.) If the agreed upon time is 12:00 pm: one arrives “on time” between 12:00 pm and 1:00 pm, “cutting it close” would be between 1:00 pm and 2:00 pm, arriving any time after 2:00 pm is “late”, and arriving any time before 12:00 pm makes one a “lunatic”.

(adj) representing the worst of something. horrible, repulsive, disgusting, annoying, bad idea, indication that if the world was ending in an hour this is the "last" of that item that you would want to be dealing with. 

Can also be used as an expression of disgust or hatred. 

(noun) the worst, lamest, epitome of a chauncey. 

Abbreviation: Lau
Nikki Haley's nickname for Jordan Thomas Cooper used in her first book.
